borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>By reason of bulk, mass, scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in a detrimental loss of outlook and privacy and significantly overbearing impact for neighbouring dwellings, especially nos.24 and 28 Marsh Green Road, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021), Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010), Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012), Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</span></div>

<span style="font-size:11pt">By reason of bulk, mass, scale, siting and design the proposed part single, part two storey rear extension combined with the hip-to-gable loft conversion, rear dormer and gabled rear loft extension&nbsp;would be disproportionately large compared to the modest-sized house, significantly changing the appearance and character of the dwelling. The proposed first storey rear extension would have excessive depth, size and scale&nbsp;dominating the rear elevation whilst the&nbsp;combined changes to the roof would result in a large&nbsp;increase volume of the roof, forming top-heavy appearance, eroding the symmetrical&nbsp;roof design of the terrace out of keeping with the design of the streetscene.&nbsp; &nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;<span style="color:#333333">The National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local LDF Core Strategy (2010), policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide DPD (2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2012), Housing Design Quality and Standards SPG (2020) and policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of&nbsp; The LBBD Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;Submission Version, 2021).</span></span><br>
description: Conversion of dwellinghouse into 3 flats and demolition of existing conservatory and construction of a part two storey part single storey rear extension and construction of a hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear dormer extension including one roof light to the front.
